intro: Myosurus scaposus, commonly known as the common scaposus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and pairs of opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Myosurus scaposus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
